CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 27, 1971, pg. 23 reads: "Hands Against The Wall, 33-year-old Stanford Barnett, of 7126 Bennett St. is frisked by police after neighbors notified Station 5 that he was brandishing a 10 gauge shotgun, which he had already discharged once. No one was injured in accident.  Photographer Charles (Teenie) Harris caught this shot after following several officers, who ran down Bennett St. with revolvers in hand, en route to arrest Bennett.  Officers said they found one spent shotgun shell on the porch of the house, and one live round in the gun chamber."
TitMainTitle: Three police officers ready to frisk Stanford Barnett at home at 7124 Bennett Street, Homewood
